titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the William E. Franklin Memorabilia, [date]

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1985-019

defitem.label: Processed by: Ashley Wellens, Student Volunteer and Kira A. Dietz, Archivist,

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection includes memorabilia from Franklin's student years (1872-1875) at Virginia Agriculture and Mechanical College: a program from the 1875 commencement exercises, an undated photo of the Cadet Corps, and an 1879 letter from Charles Martin, a professor of English.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from William E. Franklin Memorabilia must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: William E. Franklin Memorabilia, Ms1985-019, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The William E. Franklin Memorabilia collection was acquired by Special Collections prior to 1985.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the William E. Franklin Memorabilia was completed in 1985. Additional information was completed in April 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William E. Franklin attended the Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College from its founding in 1872 until his graduation in 1875. He graduated with a "Associates in Agriculture" and was a private in the cadet program. He was from Campbell County, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The William E. Franklin Memorabilia collection includes memorabilia from his student years: a program from the 1875 commencement exercises, an undated photo of the Cadet Corps, and an 1879 letter from Charles Martin, a professor of English at VAMC.
